definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood

sentences.english: She comes from a well-known family.
Mr Smith came of good station though he now sold newspapers in the street.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生眼下沿街卖报，可他却是出身望族。

sentences.english: He is lineally descended from  a respectable family.
sentences.chinese: 他是名门望族的直系后裔。

sentences.english: Shen Mingcheng was born into a family of wealth in Lishe, Ningbo.
sentences.chinese: 沈明臣出身于宁波栎社一大家望族。

sentences.english: Chapter One examines the families of rank in Jiading district to clarify the ancient local tradition.
sentences.chinese: 第一章考察嘉定世家望族，阐明当地古学传统。

sentences.english: Having gone through years of renovation, this green tree has already turned into a symbol with the glorious spirits of a prosperous family.
sentences.chinese: 苍翠的树木经历岁月荏苒，是深植望族精神的象征物。

sentences.english: Our grandfathers ancestored some of the well-known families in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我们的祖父辈是北京几家望族的祖先。

sentences.english: The Liu's surname household is a China to hope a clan, densely populated, is our country the fourth surname.
sentences.chinese: 刘氏家族乃中华之望族，人口众多，为我国第四大姓。

sentences.english: Her family is well-known in the region.
sentences.chinese: 她家在该地区是名门望族。

sentences.english: Thereupon, many distinguished 8 families came to propose marriage to the second daughter.
sentences.chinese: 于是，许多名门望族纷纷前来争聘他的第二个女儿。

sentences.english: Thereupon, many distinguished families came to propose marriage to the second daughter.
sentences.chinese: 于是，许多名门望族纷纷前来争聘他的第二个女儿。

sentences.english: She comes from a famous family.
He was the progenitor of a distinguished family.
sentences.chinese: 他是一家名门望族的始祖。

definition: offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
family with a literary reputation (idiom); literary family
family of a functionary (i.e. educated middle class in Qing times)
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
